pull.title: test: add test for decoding PSBT with per-input preimage types
pull.body: This PR adds missing test coverage for the `decodepsbt` RPC in the case that a PSBT with on of the per-input preimage types (`PSBT_IN_RIPEMD160`, `PSBT_IN_SHA256`, `PSBT_IN_HASH160`, `PSBT_IN_HASH256`; see [BIP 174](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0174.mediawiki#Specification)) is passed. As preparation, the first four commits move the already existing helpers for (de)serialization of PSBTs and PSBTMaps from the signet miner to the test framework (in a new module `psbt.py`), which should be quite useful for further tests to easily create PSBTs.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#23127](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23127) (tests: Use test framework utils where possible by vincenzopalazzo)
* [#20892](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/20892) (tests: Run both descriptor and legacy tests within a single test invocation by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
concept ACK, moving the PSBT utility functions into the testing framework proper is something I wanted regardless

events.message:
scripted-diff: rename `FromBinary` helper to `from_binary` (signet miner)

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-
sed -i s/FromBinary/from_binary/g ./contrib/signet/miner
-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

refactor: move `from_binary` helper from signet miner to test framework

Can be easily reviewed with `--color-moved=dimmed-zebra`.

refactor: move PSBT(Map) helpers from signet miner to test framework

Can be easily reviewed with `--color-moved=dimmed-zebra`.

test: add constants for PSBT key types (BIP 174)

Also take use of the constants in the signet miner to get rid of
magic numbers and increase readability and maintainability.

events.body: Rebased on master (due to trivial merge conflict in rpc_psbt.py after commit d2ed97656bba050051cfc677f1fa7eb3fc633f7d, #25590), should be easy to re-review.
looks good aside from one question of mine

events.message:
refactor: move helper `random_bytes` to util library

Can be easily reviewed with `--color-moved=dimmed-zebra`.
test: add test for decoding PSBT with per-input preimage types

events.body: Force-pushed with feedback taken from [instagibb's review comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25625#discussion_r924540431), i.e. the random bytes are now generated with the `random` module and hence could be reproduced by passing a PRNG seed (which is printed out in the test framework log).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -775,5 +788,37 @@ def test_psbt_input_keys(psbt_input, keys):
             self.nodes[0].sendrawtransaction(rawtx)
             self.generate(self.nodes[0], 1)
 
+        self.log.info("Test decoding PSBT with per-input preimage types")
+        # note that the decodepsbt RPC doesn't check whether preimages and hashes match
+        hash_ripemd160, preimage_ripemd160 = os.urandom(20), os.urandom(50)
comments.body:
this is the first instance of `urandom` in the test framework. Can we make it seed-determined instead, so that failures can be diagnosed easier?

If we don't expect failures due to randomness, we probably shouldn't do it at all then.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -775,5 +788,37 @@ def test_psbt_input_keys(psbt_input, keys):
             self.nodes[0].sendrawtransaction(rawtx)
             self.generate(self.nodes[0], 1)
 
+        self.log.info("Test decoding PSBT with per-input preimage types")
+        # note that the decodepsbt RPC doesn't check whether preimages and hashes match
+        hash_ripemd160, preimage_ripemd160 = os.urandom(20), os.urandom(50)
comments.body: Good point, I agree that seed-determined randomness is preferred here. Moved the `random_bytes` helper (which uses `random.getrandbits`) from the taproot test to the utils library and used that instead. Note that Python 3.9 offers `random.randbytes()`, but unfortunately we have Python 3.6 as minimum requirement.
